newsitem.title: USA: KCBT approves wheat "bushels to contracts" change.
newsitem.headline: KCBT approves wheat "bushels to contracts" change.

text.p: Hard red winter wheat futures at the Kansas City Board of Trade will be traded in contracts rather than bushels beginning January 2, 1998, the KCBT said Wednesday.
The change was approved by KCBT directors Tuesday and follows a similar change approved by members at the Chicago Board of Trade.
"We recognize the industry standard is changing and the Kansas City Board of Trade is proactively striving to remain competitive in the world marketplace," said KCBT Chairman Morgan Shay.
The KCBT contract will continue to represent 5,000 bushels of wheat
